alert.note: Alert for Erie; Niagara (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 25 at 9:54PM EST until February 26 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New York... Tonawanda Creek At Rapids affecting Erie and Niagara Counties. .Rain and snowmelt led to rising levels on Tonawanda Creek. Flows have reached critical levels and will slowly subside into Saturday. For the Tonawanda Creek...including Rapids...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tonawanda Creek At Rapids. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flood stage, lowland flooding of farm areas along Tonawanda Creek between Rapids and the Tonawanda Indian Reservation. Flooding may impact Fletcher, Burdick, Kirby, and Tonawanda Creek Roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM EST Friday the stage was 12.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 PM EST Friday was 12.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain around 12.3 feet though just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.9 feet on 01/08/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1000 AM EST.
